Class MazeArray

java.lang.Object
MazeArray
public class MazeArray extends Object
MazeArray represents a maze constructed from a 2D array of GridSpace objects. It provides functionality to traverse the maze recursively, searching for an exit. The maze is initialized from a string array where each character represents a different type of cell (wall, path, start, exit).

    traverseMazeRecursively(int row, int column)
    Traverses Maze Recursively Follows Algorithm: from current location, try to move one space in any possible direction( down right up left ) If it possible to move in at LEAST ONE direction, call mazeTraversal recursively passing new spot on maze as current spot

  • Method Details

    • traverseMazeRecursively

      public boolean traverseMazeRecursively(int row, int column)
      Traverses Maze Recursively Follows Algorithm: from current location, try to move one space in any possible direction( down right up left ) If it possible to move in at LEAST ONE direction, call mazeTraversal recursively passing new spot on maze as current spot
      Parameters:
      row - row being checked
      column - coloumn being checked
      Returns:
      True of False if maze has open spot to travel to

    • traverse

      public void traverse(int startRow, int startColumn)
      Method That runs the traverse maze method and determines if an exit can be found or not
      Parameters:
      startRow - Starting Row in array
      startColumn - Starting Column in array

      Returns:
